taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek pteris, fern, derived from pteron, wing or feather, for the closely spaced pinnae, which give the leaves a likeness to feathers]

key_statement.description: Veins in leaves anastomosing except sometimes near margins of ultimate segments.
Leaves not strictly 1-pinnate, at least proximal pinnae pinnatifid-lobed or variously forked or divided.
Leaves strictly 1-pinnate, pinnae not lobed or divided.
Pinnae of mature leaves decurrent to relatively broad-winged rachis in at least distal 1/2 of leaf.
Pinnae of mature leaves not decurrent to relatively broad-winged rachis or only terminal pinna decurrent on rachis.

Petioles and often also rachises densely scaly, scales light to reddish, often grading into hairs on abaxial costae; pinnae appearing not articulate to rachis, apices long-attenuate or sharply acute; sori narrow, with most of abaxial blade surface exposed.

Petioles often sparsely scaly or scaly only proximally, scales dark brown to nearly black, scales absent or few on rachises, abaxial costae with or without hairs; pinnae appearing articulate to rachis, apices acute; sori broad, little or no abaxial blade tissue exposed.
